properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 6 at 1:46PM MST until January 8 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Great Falls MT
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 5000 feet, heavy snow
occurring. Additional snow accumulations 12 to 18 inches, except
up to 24 inches toward pass level and above. Winds gusting as
high as 45 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory below 5000 feet,
snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations from 1 to 3 inches
from Browning east to as much as 8 to 12 inches toward East
Glacier. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph.

* WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front.

* WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas
of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty
winds could bring down tree branches.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on
young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local
Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY BELOW 5000 FEET
